text: <@U3BSMKS21>: No, I don't mean it. I am starting fabric using `docker-compose up`, I deploy a chaincode using `hfc` calling `memeber.deploy(deployRequest)` in my standalone application. My problem is that I am not able to see any log messages of the chaincode in the console of the running vp0 container even if it is working well - only logs generate by `membersrvc` and `vp0` ... I know when you start a peer from a command line, the logs are displayed.

text: yeah thats true. i also noticed this.
<@U0ULK2JPP> I'm happy to say that I managed to reproduce <@U10LM0FFZ> 's multichannel demo but this wasn't exactly straightforward...
we still have some ways to go before things become"turn key" :slightly_smiling_face:

hi, i have 2 chaindcode A and B, contract B is invoking a function (via invokeChaincode) in the contract A that contains a setEvent, now i want to listen on events emitted from chaincode A (with the nodejs sdk hfc) but i cannot see any events. 
Is it possible to listen on such events only on the "main" (A) chaincode in fabric v0.6 ?
thanks
<@U0P2GSA8Z> agreed … :slightly_smiling_face: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/4889/> should help with the MSPCONFIGPATH thing..
why the relative path for peer?
I thought you were moving away from those
there are many envs … hopefully common denom is fabric/..
so use path we know will likely be there (msp/sampleconfig)
